list.description: A room designed for one person with a single bed
A room with a double bed, typically designed for two people
A room with two separate single beds, suitable for friends or colleagues sharing a room
A spacious room that includes a living area and may have additional amenities
A smaller version of a suite, often with a partially separate sitting area
Two or more rooms with a door in between that can be opened to create a larger space
Two rooms next to each other without an internal door connection
A room designed to accommodate families, often with multiple beds or a sofa bed
A specially designed room for people with disabilities, featuring wider doorways, grab bars, and other accessible amenities
A luxurious and spacious room located on the top floor of the hotel
A room providing extra amenities or services, often catering to business travelers
The most luxurious and spacious suite in a hotel, offering high-end amenities and services
A typical, basic room without extra frills or special features
A room offering more space and amenities than the standard room
A room with a combined living and sleeping area, often suitable for longer stays
A room with an open layout, often with high ceilings and an open space design
A room near or with access to a pool or outdoor area
: A two-level room with living spaces on separate floors
A separate, free-standing accommodation unit typically offering more privacy and space
A luxurious accommodation option often equipped with multiple bedrooms, a kitchen, and private amenities
